result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus R Salinas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.  Eligible for CIP/ERP.
Concurrent with: 14CF1443

Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined on probation conditions.
Concurrent with: 14CF1443

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay court costs and the cost of supervision.  Defendant must provide a DNA sample and pay for the testing.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant must earn his High School Diploma while on supervision.
Defendant may not re-enroll in Racine Unified but may enroll in the satelite school recommended in the PSI if he qualifies and if the satelite school still exists.

No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a doctor and then only as prescribed.   AODA assessment and follow through; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Random UAs as deemed appropriate by the agent.  GPS or SCRAM at the recommendation of the agent.

Defendant must complete a psychological evaluation and follow through with the recommendations.  Defendant must work with his parents and the new doctor and the assessor for mental health issues.  Defendant must take medications as prescribed.  Take no other controlled substances.  Take only medications prescribed by your doctor.  
Defendant must participate in an Anger Management program and a Life Skills program.

Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
Firearms warning given.
Voting prohbited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.
No contact with the victim, GMC.
Defendant is to observe a 7 pm curfew for the next 90 days.  He may only leave the home in the presence of his mother after 7 pm.

timeConds.notes: to be used for enforcement purposes.  CFTS is to apply to the prison sentence only.
